title: The Hollywood Sign
subtitle: A caretaker explains the history, maintenance and protection of the famous Hollywood sign.

cards.text: The film industry continued to grow and the name Hollywood, which by the 1920s represented not just a city but an industry and lifestyle, was made official when the 'Hollywoodland' sign was erected in 1923. It was only supposed to last about a year. ... But it wasn't always. It started out as a massive billboard advertising an upscale suburban development called Hollywoodland.
cards.question: Which sentence links the original sign to today’s symbol?
choices: Things have changed a lot since then.
It's still there, of course, and is a symbol of the entertainment world.
We used to have real problems.
They mostly get turned down.
cards.highlight: It's still there, of course, and is a symbol of the entertainment world.

cards.text: The letters in the sign weren’t straight and still aren’t. ... They follow the shape of Mount Lee and this is part of their narrative.
cards.question: Which sentence emphasizes the need to preserve the letters’ positions?
choices: If one of them ever fell down I would have to put it back up at exactly the same angle.
Even so, people still try to climb over the barrier, mostly innocent tourists surprised that you can't walk right up to the sign.

cards.text: When I first arrived in 1989, security was pretty low-tech — we put up a fence around the sign to stop trespassers messing with it. But people just jumped over the fence. The back of the sign was black with graffiti and barbed wire, but they still got through. ... So I decided to improve the effectiveness of the security.

cards.text: Now we have motion-detectors and cameras. Everything goes via the internet to a dedicated team watching structures around the city. ... But they can get a closer look on one of my regular tours.

cards.text: It’s also important to protect the sign’s image as it’s used in adverts and news pieces. There's a simple rule about how the sign can be used. However, it mostly comes down to the look. ... To take another example, if you used ‘Hollywood’ in your company name it would depend whether it was just text or used the actual image of the sign.
cards.question: Which sentence explains what happens with commercial use?
choices: If the purpose is commercial — to promote something — payment has to be made.

cards.highlight: If the purpose is commercial — to promote something — payment has to be made.

cards.text: People call up with the most ridiculous ideas: they want to light the sign, paint it pink, or cover it to promote a product. You’ll get an enthusiastic marketing executive ring up terribly excited because they think they're the first person with the idea. ... That’s because we don’t like to change the image and we hope it keeps its significance.
